result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. THOMAS J LUECK

records.addlTxt:
NOT ON THE RECORD 

Defendant THOMAS J LUECK in court.  Attorney Gerise Marie Laspisa in court for State of Wisconsin. Defendant stated he is waiting for the public defender's officer to appoint him an attorney. Court states he'll give the public defender's office more time to appoint an attorney. Court sets Status of Counsel on December 20, 2022 at 10:00 AM.
Second appearance scheduled for December 20, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Second appearance on December 20, 2022 at 10:00 am.

10:34 AM Defendant THOMAS J LUECK in court.  Attorney Gerise Marie Laspisa in court for State of Wisconsin. Court states the defendant qualifies for the public defender and they are still looking for representation. Court schedules status of counsel for November 1, 2022 at 1:00 PM.

Court adjourned at 10:35 AM.
Second appearance scheduled for November 1, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Second appearance on November 1, 2022 at 10:00 am.
OSPD Appointment of Counsel Report, is eligible but no attorney appointed yet
Preliminary Hearing - Schedule or Waiver on September 7, 2022 at 10:00 am.

records.descr: Waiver of time limits for preliminary hearing

records.addlTxt: Defendant is to complete processing with the Green Lake County Sheriff's Department. Defendant is to maintain absolute sobriety - not to possess or consume any alcohol, illegal drugs or prescription drugs without a valid prescription.  You may be randomly tested for compliance

Defendant is to complete processing with the Green Lake County Sheriff's Department. Defendant is to maintain absolute sobriety - not to possess or consume any alcohol, illegal drugs or prescription drugs without a valid prescription.  You may be randomly tested for compliance

10:02 AM Defendant THOMAS J LUECK in court.  Attorney Michael Kapelis appeared in court for THOMAS J LUECK. Attorney Gerise Marie Laspisa in court for State of Wisconsin. Atty Kapelis confirms receipt of the criminal complaint and waives reading and requests a preliminary hearing. Court instructs the defendant of the maximum penalty on each count. Defendant is eligible for the public defender. DA makes bond recommendation. Court sets bond at $500 signature bond and conditions of: Defendant is to complete processing with the Green Lake County Sheriff's Department. Defendant is to maintain absolute sobriety - not to possess or consume any alcohol, illegal drugs or prescription drugs without a valid prescription.  You may be randomly tested for compliance.  Court instructs defendant regarding his/her right to a preliminary hearing. Defendant waives the time limits. Court will set for Status of Prelim September 7, 2022 at 10:00 AM.

Court adjourned at 10:05 AM.
